intro: Ribes viridissimum, commonly known as the green currant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Grossulariaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of western North America, particularly in the western United States and southern British Columbia. The plant produces small, green berries that are edible and have a tart flavor, often used in culinary applications. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. The plant is also valued for its ornamental qualities, with attractive foliage and clusters of white flowers in the spring.
